choices.D: The current on-premises environment must first be upgraded to Dynamics AX 2009R3
choices.B: The migration can run without upgrading the current on-premises environment.
choices.C: The current on-premises environment must first be upgraded to Dynamics AX 2012 R2.
choices.A: The current on-premises environment must first be upgraded to Dynamics 365 Finance online.

questions.question_text:
You are preparing to migrate data to a Dynamics 365 Finance environment from Dynamics AX 2009.
You have to make sure that the data migration can be executed.
Which of the following is TRUE with regards to this scenario?

comments.content:
Correct answer is indeed "B".
The question is about migrating DATA ONLY, it's not about upgrading the application.
Please cancel this post. The answer is C as mentioned in the test.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct as there is no upgrade required in AX 2009. Using the DMF the data has to be moved to data migration group in 2009 and import in D365, Data Management.

Selected Answer: B
Correct

to make sure data are migrated you do not need to upgrade from AX2009 to AX2012.

The answer is C

Upgrade is currently only supported from either Dynamics AX 2012 R2 or Dynamics AX 2012 R3. For each release, please update to the latest available cumulative update before upgrading to latest finance and operations application release.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct. They ask for "data" migration, not code upgrade. You do not have to go through AX2012. In that case, it wouldn't be possible to migrate data from other legacy systems either.
Take DMT and do the migration :)

Selected Answer: B
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/data-migration-tool

Data migration can be done from starting any Ax2009 version. 
Upgrade can be done from Ax2012R2.

C is correct.

To migrate data from Dynamics AX 2009 to Dynamics 365 Finance, the current on-premises environment must first be upgraded to Dynamics AX 2012 R2. This is because Dynamics AX 2012 R2 is the minimum version required for data migration to Dynamics 365 Finance. Once the upgrade to Dynamics AX 2012 R2 is complete, the data can then be migrated to Dynamics 365 Finance. It is not necessary to upgrade to Dynamics 365 Finance online before migrating the data.

Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 Data migration tool (DMT) to migrate your data from AX 2009 to Finance and Operations. Using the DMT is the only supported upgrade path from AX 2009. The DMT helps you find and fill gaps between the table schemas for each version, as well as helping you move your data.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/data-migration-tool

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are preparing to migrate data to a Dynamics 365 Finance environment from Dynamics AX 2012.
You have been given the responsibility of managing and preparing a cutover to make sure that the experience for end users during the cutover is effortless.
You have already executed a basic data upgrade validation. You now need to need to execute a cutover.
Which of the following actions should execute in sequence? Answer by dragging the correct options from the list to the answer area.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

You are preparing to migrate data to Dynamics 365 Finance from a personalized version of a legacy application. A number of the fields in the entity are identical, while others vary.
You want to automatically map as much fields as you can within Dynamics 365 Finance.
You create source mapping.
Does this action map the fields in Dynamics 365 Finance?

discussion.content:
Should be yes because If you have extended an entity (added fields) or if the automatic mapping appears to be incorrect, the mapping of the entity can be regenerated in the Mapping form.

To do this, click Generate source mapping.

A message will display asking, "Do you want to generate the mapping from scratch ?"

Click Yes to regenerate the mapping.

comments.content:
It can't be "A", Because Questions asks "You want to automatically map as much fields as you can".

Generate Source Mapping is not an automatic process.
Create source mapping is different from Generate source mapping.
No, you are wrong, if mapping is not correct you can manually map the fields.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct

I believe the option answer B is correct as the loaded file auto map with the field in the entities which can be viewed in the visual mapping
